abstract: The sight of Larry Page and Sergey Brin is enough to strike fear into a newspaper editor’s heart. After all, the giant Internet company they founded, Google, has become a powerful force for democratizing the distribution of news, blogs and other forms of information, a trend that has left many in the industry bracing for the day when the print newspaper is dead.
lead_paragraph: The sight of Larry Page and Sergey Brin is enough to strike fear into a newspaper editor’s heart. After all, the giant Internet company they founded, Google, has become a powerful force for democratizing the distribution of news, blogs and other forms of information, a trend that has left many in the industry bracing for the day when the print newspaper is dead.

headline.main: Google Guys Aren’t Writing Off Old Media
